title: Monster Bash?
content:
Hey all,

I was wondering if there anyone had looked at the similarities between the way Commander Keen and Monster bash store their data, and in fact if there was any chance of a monster bash editor coming out?

Cheers.

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: Hi, too bad I have no info about that, or I haven't heard anything. But editors to another classic games would be cool to have more.."For years they studied, collected, catalogued. When they had learned all that they could, they began to modify." 3001: The final Odyssey

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: I've never played Monster Bash, so I don't know about any similarities. But I agree, it would be neat to have more editors.

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: i think i've got a save game editor or something on one of my shareware CDs, but I don't think i'm gonna bother looking for it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] Family, Religion, Friendship. These are the three demons you must slay if you wish to succeed in business! - Charles Montgomery Burns

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: Monster Bash wasn't made with the Keen 4 engine -- it looks to me like it was made with the Duke Nukum engine, so possibly a DN editor might help.

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: Hm. As I recall, it seems very similar in engine to Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure. Some of the tools for that might work both ways. Just a thought.

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: On another note (that's the second time I've used that pun tonight)  Does anyone have the Monster Bash music in IMF?

title: grrr...
content:
I've sat in front of printouts of 1's and 0's all day today trying to figure out how the $#%^# compression works, still can't figure it out...*sigh* No-one's figured this out as of yet, right?

edit: this probably goes into 'the classics' forum...

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: Is Monster Bash EGA (16 colors)??

title: Re: Monster Bash?
content: Yeah, monster bash is EGA - 16 colors chosen from a 64-color palette, I think.

title: Duke2, Cosmo, MBash
content:
Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure uses an engine that looks a bit like Duke Nukem 2.

Monster Bash on the other hand uses another engine:
[url=http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?GeraldLindsly]c2.com/cgi/wiki?GeraldLindsly[/url]
[quote]Quote:[hr]the game is ancient Chinese technology, it is a classic example of pushing the machine to its limits. In my biased opinion, it is worth the look see. Btw, I designed and coded the system software. See the credits page. The term FAST, coined by Apogee president Scott Miller as I recall, stands for Fluid Animation Software Technology. At the time when the game was first published, there was no other technology in its class. actually, there still is no other... it is probably the best EGA game ever produced.[hr][/quote]

BTW Why isn't this in the Classic forum?

title: Re: Duke2, Cosmo, MBash
content: MB has that FAST engine, if 4got the name because its been so long since reading about Apogee's history. the dn2 & cosmo engines weren't as smooth nor was it as good as the MB engine. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]  Family, Religion, Friendship. These are the three demons you must slay if you wish to succeed in business! - Charles Montgomery Burns

title: Re: Duke2, Cosmo, MBash
content:
Ah, Monster Bash...a great game indeed. I think it uses the same engine as Keen4-6 and Bio Menace. You can notice the similarities between Monster Bash & BMenace, and between BMenace & Keens4-6. They all have different art, but they most certainly use the same engine.Over and out.

[img]http://server5.uploadit.org/files2/231203-upno12.gif[/img]

[img]http://members.lycos.co.uk/animation_by_mistake/myhorse.gif[/img]
That's My Horse
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sleepslug.gif[/img]<---I like the sleeping slug.

title: link
content: Gerald Lindsly updated [url=http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?GeraldLindsly]his site[/url] with some information about Monster Bash Hacking. Looks like it uses a LZW compression. Too bad I don't know much about LZW.

title: Re: link
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I think it uses the same engine as Keen4-6 and Bio Menace.[hr][/quote]

of course it doesn't! I don't think the engines are similar at all... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/apogeekeen/silly.txt[/img] > Hello Kiddies! I'm Silly the Ghost!

title: Re: Bash
content: It does not, repeat NOT use the Keen 4 or Biomenace engine. Its engine is unique, simalar to Cosmo crossed with Duke Nukum."No one should be here" -Level Lord

title: Re: Bash
content:
But Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure uses the same engine as Duke Nukem II.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Bash
content: Exactly. If it were the same as cosmo then it'd also be the same as Duke Nukum 2. However from what I can tell it has some simalarities with Duke 1 in it, making it different from both cosmo and Duke 2."No one should be here" -Level Lord

title: Re: Bash
content:
Gerald Linsly put the following on his page:

[quote]I have some C/386 code to extract the BASH?.dat files. Perhaps post soon? I really crunches out LZW QIK (of course, FAST!) Any requests to see here? VOTES?: [/quote]

Votes would be good. The quicker this is out the quicker an viewer/editor thing can come out.

[url=http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?GeraldLindsly]c2.com/cgi/wiki?GeraldLindsly[/url]

title: Re: Bash
content:
One [1] vote.If no one gets whats going on- too bad!

UR A Frt Ltl Mrt Dsinhrt!

"No one should be here" -Level Lord

title: Re: Bash
content:
"Here are some hints to get you
started with {14}MONSTER BASH{7}.

1. You can see more of the game by
looking up and down.

{14}LOOK UP - {11}PgUp{7}

{14}LOOK DOWN - {11}PgDn{7}"

Yep, got text files to decompress. With any luck, I'll soon have the rest of the data decompressing (text is done slightly differently to images, music, etc), but with any luck I might have that done fairly soon. Onwards, to the monster bash editor!

title: Monster Bash Editor Ahoy!
content:
[hr]Sz Onwards, to the monster bash editor!
[hr][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

>Commander SpleenCave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

Once upon a time was a backbeat,
Once upon a time all the chords came to life
And the angels had guitars even before thay had wings
If you hold onto a chorus you can get through the night
> Meat Loaf - Rock And Roll Dreams Come Through

JimSoft Lair
http://jimsoftlair.tripod.com/

title: nice
content: It's nice to read that [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] .

title: Re: nice
content:
OK, I'm gonna need a bit of help here. I'm assuming that someone on this board has written up code for viewing images in other Apogee games. Now, I've got sprite to decompress, for the most part, and if I just spit them out, bit by bit, black and white, I get the following (this is Johnny Dash exiting a level):

[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/johnny.gif[/img]

Now, this seems odd to me. There's a bitmask, followed by 4 or so copies of different parts of the same image. Shouldn't the image be stored as a bitmask, 1 bit black and white, followed by 16-bit color information, or am I missing something important?

title: ega
content:
Do you know how the ega memory works? With planes/layers?

There's a plane for blue, green, red, intensity (and in this case a 5th one for transparancy.)

title: Re: ega
content:
OMG! Progress! You are a god!If no one gets whats going on- too bad!

UR A Frt Ltl Mrt Dsinhrt!

"No one should be here" -Level Lord

title: Re: ega
content: Oh, sounds really good! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] We want Keen Chronicles!

title: Re: ega
content:
(ignore the bits of red, I haven't got the colours 100% right yet)

[img]http://members.optusnet.com.au/ianshevvy/dog.gif[/img]

Toot toot!

It's getting there, for sure...

title: Re: ega
content: shweet! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/apogeekeen/silly.txt[/img] > Hello Kiddies! I'm Silly the Ghost!

title: Re: ega
content: Woah, even more progress! You seem to r0xx0r!We want Keen Chronicles!

title: Re: ega
content:
There's still *a lot* of problems, (anything over 11k and the decompression dies, sprites that change size from frame to frame are corrupted), but I've checked and music extracts fine (2 songs are less than 11k so I can even play them in winamp, groovin' to demons.imf is something I've always wanted to do), all the sounds play and give no errors, and all sprites where the frames are the same size work 100%, so I can be pretty sure that the decompression works the same for all the data, which is a big plus.


[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/workout2.gif[/img]

[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/tman_bl.gif[/img]

[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/hell_head.gif[/img]

title: Re: ega
content:
Very nice. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]
Maybe there's some compression for the already compressed data (on the files that are over 11k) or it uses something different compression algorithm (that takes more time to load (or well, took with 90s comps) but fits smaller size).
And if the sprite's frames are different sized; maybe there's some table that has the dimensions for each frame?We want Keen Chronicles!

title: Re: ega
content:
Daily update [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pirate.gif[/img] :

- Fixed the changing frame size error, all full-color sprites work 100%

- Sprites that change colour depth between frames don't work after the first change of colour depth

- Sprites that don't have 5 planes of colour need you to manually set the number of planes, this is a small issue tho.

- Decompression now works for all files, large or small, it seems. All music extracts fine, while decompressing the levels/tiles/background images gives me a 'decompressed size matches expected size' for most files...the rest are probably fine too.

FG images / BG images / levels / screens are too big a job for me to work out for now, I'm taking a few days break on this.

content:
W00t! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] If no one gets whats going on- too bad!

content: Woah, awesome progress! *thumbs up* [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] We want Keen Chronicles!

content: So, um... When can we have some Monster Bash IMF files? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

content: Not just yet.  I don't like releasing programs till I'm happy with them, and this one's still not ready.

title: Re: Bemusic.
content:
Hmmm. I thought I could give this thing a rest for a few days, guess I want to finish it, hey.

Got backgrounds, tilemaps, foreground tiles, and background-ons working.

[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/tilemap.gif[/img]

Tilemap (part of one, can't post too much or the copyright squad will be after me [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] )

[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/foreground.gif[/img]

Foreground tiles

[img]http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/bon.gif[/img]
Background-on

Soooooooo - only levels are left, plus some minor sprite stuff.

(edit: got level backgrounds to draw, with some minor errors.)
